EmailTemplate.subject: San Francisco Meetups: Accessing External Hadoop Data Sources using Pivotal Xtension Framework & Building 'Bootiful' Applications with Spring Boot
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Accessing External Hadoop Data Sources using Pivotal Xtension Framework (PXF) with Sameer Tiwari Join us Tuesday evening, April 8, 2014, at the San Francisco Pivotal Office <https://maps.google.com/maps?q=875+Howard+Street+5th+Floor,+San+Francisco,+CA> for a meetup entitled, Accessing External Hadoop Data Sources using Pivotal Xtension Framework (PXF) with Sameer Tiwari.
Learn more and Register here: http://bit.ly/POSH0031 <https://www.google.com/url?q=http://bit.ly/POSH0031&sa=D&usg=ALhdy2_tneK3fvwZi_Pt0tF8dU0ko1xR0A>
Schedule: 5:30-6:30 pm Pizza and networking 6:30-8:00pm Talk and Q&A 8:00-8:30 pm Wind down
Pivotal Xtension Framework (PXF) is an external table interface that gives SQL access on top of data stored within the Hadoop ecosystem. It enables loading and querying of data stored in HDFS, HBase and Hive. It supports a wide range of data formats such as Text, AVRO, Hive, Sequence, RCFile formats and HBase.
About the speaker: Sameer Tiwari
Sameer Tiwari is the Hadoop Architect at Pivotal, Inc. building the next generation systems for Big Data Analytics. - See more at: http://blog.gopivotal.com/author/sameertiwari#sthash.D6NH4fMa.dpuf <http://blog.gopivotal.com/author/sameertiwari#sthash.D6NH4fMa.dpuf>
Building 'Bootiful' Applications with Spring Boot with Josh Long & Phil Webb Join us Tuesday evening, April 10, 2014, at the San Francisco Pivotal Office <https://maps.google.com/maps?q=875+Howard+Street+5th+Floor,+San+Francisco,+CA> for a meetup entitled, Building 'Bootiful' Applications with Spring Booth with Josh Long & Phil Webb.
Register here: http://bit.ly/POSH0032 <https://www.google.com/url?q=http://bit.ly/POSH0032&sa=D&usg=ALhdy29KhLdHE3bkDDLOlYFW0Sipn6YKaw>
Schedule: 5:30-6:30pm Pizza and Networking 6:30-8:00pm Talk and Q&A 8:00-8:30pm Wind down
Alright, so maybe "bootiful" won't ever work, but I tried, and it was worth it too because you're reading this. Spring Boot, the new convention-over-configuration centric framework from the Spring team at Pivotal, marries Spring's flexibility with conventional, common sense defaults to make application development not just fly, but pleasant!
About the speakers:
Josh Long is the Spring developer advocate. Josh is the lead author on Apressâ€™ Spring Recipes, 2nd Edition, and a SpringSource committer and contributor. He blogs at blog.springsource.org <http://blog.springsource.org> or joshlong.com <http://joshlong.com>
Phil Webb is a Spring Framework developer and co-creator of the Spring Boot project. Prior to joining Pivotal and relocating to California, Phil worked for a number of UK technology companies. https://spring.io/team/pwebb <https://spring.io/team/pwebb>
